trial_identification.studytitle: Rituximab in Primary Central Nervous system Lymphoma. A randomized Dutch/Belgian Hemato-Oncology Cooperative Group (HOVON) / Australasian Leukaemia and Lymphoma Group (ALLG) intergroup study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Rituximab in Primary Central Nervous system Lymphoma. A randomized Dutch/Belgian Hemato-Oncology Cooperative Group (HOVON) / Australasian Leukaemia and Lymphoma Group (ALLG) intergroup study

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Lymphoma (non Hodgkin's lymphoma) - High grade lymphoma

interventions.interventions: 2 courses (4 weeks each) of R-MBVP (Rituximab 375mg/m2 intravenously (i.v), course 1 days 0,7,14,21, course 2 days 0 and 14; methotrexate 3g/m2 iv days 1,15 for all courses; Teniposide 100mg/m2 i.v days 2,3 for all courses; BCNU (Carmustine) 100mg/m2 i.v day 4 for all courses; prednisolone 60mg/m2 orally or i.v days 1-5 for all courses) Following randomisation to MBVP or R-MBVP, patients will undergo an MRI. Patients with less than a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) will be removed from study. Responding patients undergo consolidation with cytarabine (2 g/m2 i.v days 1,2) and have another MRI. Patients greater than or equal to 61 years of age will finish protocol treatment here. Patients with relapse or progressive disease will be withdrawn from study. Patients less than or equal to 60 years of age will undergo whole brain radiotherapy- if CR or (complete remission-unconfirmed) CRu- 20 x 1.5 Gy; if PR 20 x 1.5 Gy and boost 20 x 0.5 Gy. Patients will then have another MRI.
interventions.comparator: 2 courses (4 weeks each) of MBVP (methotrexate 3g/m2 iv days 1,15 for all courses; Teniposide 100mg/m2 i.v days 2,3 for all courses; BCNU (Carmustine) 100mg/m2 i.v day 4 for all courses; prednisolone 60mg/m2 orally or i.v days 1-5 for all courses) Following randomisation to MBVP or R-MBVP, patients will undergo an MRI. Patients with less than a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) will be removed from study. Responding patients undergo consolidation with cytarabine (2 g/m2 i.v days 1,2) and have another MRI. Patients greater than or equal to 61 years of age will finish protocol treatment here. Patients with relapse or progressive disease will be withdrawn from study. Patients less than or equal to 60 years of age will undergo whole brain radiotherapy- if CR or CRu- 20 x 1.5 Gy; if PR 20 x 1.5 Gy and boost 20 x 0.5 Gy. Patients will then have another MRI.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Event-free survival of all patients defined as failure (relapse, no CR or CRu) or death from any cause.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: after (R-)MBVP, after high dose cytarabine and after completion of radiotherapy

trial_design.concealment: Patients are enrolled and randomised centrally at HOVON data centre.
trial_design.sequence: sequential generation of randomisation in order of enrolment

recruitment.hospital: Royal Melbourne Hospital - City campus - Parkville

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: VU University Medical Center, P.O.Box 7057 1007 MB Amsterdam

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 4-10 Inman Road Dee Why NSW 2099 Australia

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Level 2/10 St Andrews Place East Melbourne, VIC, 3002

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Newly diagnosed PCNS lymphoma patients will be randomised to either 2 courses of MBVP or 2 courses of MBVP+Rituximab. All patients will undergo an MRI at the end of chemotherapy and be assessed for consolidation treatment with AraC, after which these patients will undergo another MRI to determine their eligibility or need for WBRT or not. The primary objective of the trial is event free survival.
